meanings.definition: To make or fabricate (a word or phrase).
meanings.sent1: She quoined a new term for her invention.
meanings.sent2: The author quoined a catchy slogan for the campaign.
meanings.sent3: The students quoined a secret code for their club meetings.
meanings.sent4: He quoined a magical spell to protect his home.
meanings.sent5: The chef quoined a unique name for his signature dish.

meanings.sent1: The detective quoined a clever plan to catch the thief.
meanings.sent2: She quoined a story to explain her absence.
meanings.sent3: The kids quoined a wild excuse for their messy room.
meanings.sent4: He quoined a brilliant idea for the school project.
meanings.sent5: The artist quoined a colorful character for her comic book.

meanings.definition: To create or produce (something) in a skillful or clever way.
meanings.sent1: The baker quoined a delicious recipe for the new cake.
meanings.sent2: She quoined a beautiful painting for the art exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The engineer quoined a unique design for the bridge.
meanings.sent4: He quoined a powerful melody for the song.
meanings.sent5: The designer quoined an elegant dress for the fashion show.
